ygData.subject: Re: Gladiator-general
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, folks! Sorry for the delay in responding. Let s see if I can answer any questions. ... For the moment, it s on indefinite hold :( Basically, the overall
ygData.rawEmail:
X-Digest-Num: 53
Message-ID: <17248.53.137.959279670@...>
Date: Wed, 20 Oct 1999 17:58:09 -0400
From: Tom Ricket <tricket@...
Subject: Re: Gladiator-general

Hi, folks! Sorry for the delay in responding. Let's see if I can answer any 
questions.

Lordofthecheese wrote:
>I've been a Gladiators fan for a long time but when is the Beyond Freedom
>Sequal coming out? I tried to download it but the link is broken. Is 
>anyone even working on it anymore? It's been dead for a long time. Is 
>FSGAMES Still running?

And dimento wrote:

>Hello,
>I just started playing Gladiator recently
>and I must say that it's a heck of a game. I've
>visited the official page at http://www.fsgames.com
>and I've visited http://plaza.v-wave.com/shayd/
>It seems that nothing's happenning any more though...
>(1) When is Gladiator: Beyond Freedom coming out?

For the moment, it's on indefinite hold :( Basically, the overall story 
goes as such: we (FSGames) originally programmed the Gladiator 3.X series 
as a group of 4 programmers; later on, we got a professional artist to work 
with us on G:BF and other projects (such as Plux) as well.  However, in the 
last 18 months, two things happened: (1) most of the group members moved to 
different parts of the country to pursue assorted computer jobs, and (2) 
two of our group joined up with Blizzard, and are working full-time on the 
"Diablo 2" project.  Now, don't get me wrong -- we're *very* psyched that 
they're working on D2 (which looks to be a GREAT game!), but those two 
things together have meant that our coding on G:BF has dwindled 
dramatically.  And in the computer industry, if you're not coding on a 
project full-time, keeping it up-to-date, a project, especially a game, can 
quickly become dated.

>(2) Is there a demo out there for Beyond Freedom?

There's supposed to be -- apparently there's something somewhat screwed up 
with our web server. I keep meaning to either fix the current link, or put 
up a newer demo... Since I've been doing a lot of work with the creator of 
Sluggy Freelance lately (which I highly recommend, at http://sluggy.com), I 
keep forgetting to do that.  I'll try soon, honest!

>(3) Are there any other sites/links I can visit
>relating to Gladiator other than the ones mentioned
>above?

That I don't know..

>(4) Is the FSGAMES group still developing games?

Right now, we (a) get together online and play other people's games, and 
(b) work on games for other companies, ala the D2 stuff I 
mentioned.  Unfortunately, we haven't been able to keep up FSGames in-house 
projects recently :(

>Anyways, I'd just like to send out a hello to
>everyone on this list and compliment the programmers
>on a game well-made.

Many thanks!

Take care, folks!
--Tom
